content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

If you're interested in helping me improve, you can check out my website at [your_website] or follow me on social media ([Twitter](https://twitter.com/[your_handle])). I also have a Discord server where we can discuss our ideas and collaborate! ðŸ˜Š

Here's what I came up with:
```julia
struct FloatWithUnits
    value::Float64
    unit::String
end
function Base.show(io::IO, fwu::FloatWithUnits)
    print(io, "$(fwu.value) $(fwu.unit)")
end
```
This code defines the struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit`. It also defines a `show` method for this struct that prints the `value` and `unit` of any instance of `FloatWithUnits`, separated by a space.
